Melly Goeslaw Merasa Dibully, Ini Kata Pakar Soal Perundungan
03 Nov 2019, 09:15 by Eka Wahyu Pramita, Mila Novita
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Melly Goeslaw merasa jadi korban bullying atau perundungan setelah sosoknya sebagai cosplay di pesta Halloween akhir Oktober 2019 lalu. Ia mengungkapkan ketidaknyamanannya melalui Instagram Stories yang saat ini sudah dihapus. Penyanyi dan pencipta lagu ini mengaku sudah memaafkan dan melupakan kasus tersebut.
Istri Anto Hoed itu lalu mengunggah video di Instagram TV, Sabtu, 2 November 2019. Ia menjelaskan jika merasa tak nyaman dengan apa yang diperbuat oleh-oleh teman-temannya. Melly Goeslaw juga mengajak pengikutnya untuk berani speak up kalau menjadi korban bully, di akhir kalimat keterangan video ia menegaskan lebih baik kehilangan teman-teman untuk menjaga kesehatan hatinya.
Sebenarnya bagaimana kalau kita menjadi korban bullying? Menurut Psikologis Klinis Kasandra Putranto sikap bullying atau perundungan adalah perilaku kekerasan yang menyakiti hati orang lain, jika seseorang merasa sakit hati berarti ia jadi korban.
"Secara neuropsikologi, mereka yang melakukan bullying awalnya pernah mengalami, tidak mendapat pola asuh yang penuh cinta baik dari keluarga atau lingkungan terdekat," ucapnya saat ditemui Tempo.co usai acara pelindung Body Mist Sweet Treats Collection di Jakarta, Sabtu, 2 November.
Kasandra menambahkan penerimaan perundungan pada manusia memang berbeda, dan para pelaku bullying merasa yang dilakukan hal yang biasa karena pengaruh pernah menjadi korban. "Tapi kita sekarang sudah bisa speak up, ada aturannya dan undang-undang jika kita merasa tidak terima dengan sikap bullying," ucapnya.
Kasandra pun mengatakan sikap bullying jangan dimaklumi sebab lama-lama akan biasa saja padahal itu menyebabkan efek psikologis bagi yang menerima. Belum lagi ditambah peran media sosial yang menjadi wadah paling mudah buat melakukan bullying pada orang lain hingga para public figure menjadi korban.
"Sudah banyak ya kasus orang sampai mengakhiri hidupnya karena merasa di-bully. Seperti yang baru-baru ini terjadi artis muda Korea, sebenarnya ia bukan bunuh diri tapi 'dibunuh' oleh kata-kata bully dari para haters-nya," ujar Kasandra.

Melly Goeslaw Feeling Bullied, This Said Experts About Harassment
03 Nov 2019, 09:15 by Eka Wahyu Pramita, Mila Novita
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Melly Goeslaw feels she is a victim of bullying after her figure as cosplay at a Halloween party at the end of October 2019. He expressed his discomfort through Instagram Stories which has now been removed. The singer and songwriter claimed to have forgiven and forgotten the case.
Anto Hoed's wife then uploaded a video on Instagram TV, Saturday, November 2, 2019. He explained that he felt uncomfortable with what his friends were doing. Melly Goeslaw also invited her followers to speak up if they were victims of bullying, at the end of the video statement she stressed that it is better to lose friends to maintain a healthy heart.
What if we become victims of bullying? According to Clinical Psychologist Kasandra Putranto bullying or harassment is a violent behavior that hurts other people, if someone feels hurt then he becomes a victim.
"Neuropsychologically, those who did the bullying initially experienced, not getting loving parenting from their family or immediate environment," he said when met by Tempo.co after the Body Mist Sweet Treats Collection collection in Jakarta, Saturday, November 2.
Kasandra added that acceptance of harassment in humans is indeed different, and the perpetrators of bullying feel that the usual thing is done because of the influence of being a victim. "But we can now speak up, there are rules and laws if we feel we don't accept the bullying attitude," he said.
Kasandra also said that bullying should not be understood because after a long time it will be normal even though it causes psychological effects for those who receive it. Not to mention the role of social media, which is the easiest place to bully other people until the public figures become victims.
"There have been many cases of people to end their lives because they feel bullied. Like what recently happened a young Korean artist, in fact he did not commit suicide but was 'killed' by the bullies from his haters," Kasandra said.
